Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location, a block away from San Marco square. The shower was a little small, and the water in the mornings was not very warm, nothing serious though.

Reviews.Title: “Pick another”
Reviews.Author: amaroo_9
Reviews.Content: Wow where to start, its a great location that's about it, the room they had put us in had tissue paper sticking out of the ceiling, could only be explained like an attic, the windows were incredibly small but opening. Beds terrible, didn't try the breakfast as chose to eat on the run which if you didn't eat in the Square was a much better way to save some money. The water taxi will cost you 60E from the train station and the water bus is extremely over crowded and with luggage probably not such a great idea. Venice is a lovely place but very busy and we weren't there during the summer/festival times. If you are travelling with a group of female friends and wishing to stay at this hotel, beware the gentleman in the shop across the way, he will stalk you, he even had the gall to ask my friend if he could come up to our room whilst standing at the reception awaiting our key.

Reviews.Title: “So close to St Mark's”
Reviews.Author: David W
Reviews.Content: On our recent trip around Europe we booked as we travelled and found this great hotel right in the heart of Venice , 200 metres to St Mark's doors. Well appointed with a great breakfast, all but one of the staff were helpful. The night manager is like an Italian Basil Faulty. I asked for if they had any waste cardboard boxes to pack a venitian mask in my pack. An emphatic No was the reply. I asked what about the empty one near the printer, "no we use all our boxes." REALLY Other than that we had a super time, but for the 4 of us , we had to book 2 rooms, which made it a bit pricey

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: Reinaldo A
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a Good location, this is the place to stay. Forget about modern decorations in the Rooms or Lobby, this was my 2nd visit in a year and will try a third one.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Best Western Albergo San Marco”
Reviews.Author: Cheruthon N
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Rome and Venice on 17th of March 2012. The best western at Rome was good and then I went to Venice. The hotel is in the center of San Marco which is a definite advantage but finding it was hell. None of them knew the hotel. The hotel is very old and the room was a riot. The doors reminds me of my grandmothers house. Room Keys are given which is difficult to open. Once you open the door you cannot get in the room is tiny and toilet even smaller. No hot water at all. I think they run on solar, when you ask they go rude. The breakfast was horrible, eggs come in by 8 or 8.30. I actually saw a small cockroach on their coffee machine. Did not even bother to complain as the guys were tight lipped. You go to their restaurant and the waiter there, smart looking with long hair things he is the customer he knows english very well but does not speak and talks in italian, hence i started talking in my lingo as well. My suggestion is guys please stay in the mainland and take a boat to san marco which is the only square nothing much to see as well. Please note there though you book your room as air conditioned, no ac is allowed until 01 april 2012. so had to open window and sleep. Honestly nothing much to see except the glass works in venice and definitely paying this kind of money to this hotel is not worth it. Best Western should do mystery shopping on this hotel and if possible please remove your brand name attached to the hotel it is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, room; unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Edwin B
Reviews.Content: We loved the location and rooms for our first trip to Venice as a family of 4, kids ages 8 and 11. We had two adjoining rooms which had a vestibule in common with ample storage in an armoire for all our luggage and coats (it was March), a safe, and an ample bath with countertop around the sink (Room #203). Beds and furniture were nice. No view, opened onto a closed square. Just so surprising to be received by sour staff, and the brusque dining staff for the breakfast, in comparison to all the other hotels we visited in northern Italy (including the Best Western Hotel Crimea in Turin where the staff is the best!). Shameful that in this one the management has not done better to coach the broad smiles, friendly eye contact and offers to help or make suggestions that makes or breaks the relationship. It's not rocket science. This hotel allows pets. (They frowned on the size of our dog (golden retriever), though they have no restrictions and we booked through the 1-800 Best Western operator; at least we got a good rate, a "hot deal" about 10 days before our trip.) The maids, in comparison to other staff, were very friendly! I would rate it higher than average, but the unfriendly interactions force a lower rating.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the small print!!”
Reviews.Author: Maryse G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is to say the least in need of a major refurbishment. We were allocated to the 5th floor and had to cart our luggage with no help at all up two flights of stairs after taking the lift to the 4th floor. The furniture and bathrooms facilities are certainly not up to the standard of a Best Western hotel. It was impossible to take a shower due to no hot water in the outdated bathroom. On settling our bill we were charged Euros 175 for one night whereas other members of our group were charged Euros 105. Upon questioning this we were advised that our rate covers full cancellation refund whereas the booking made by the others is non refundable!! We are frequent travellers and are fully aware of cancellation charges which vary from one hotel to another but this policy is quite unacceptable. Please be aware of this when booking this hotel and read the small print!!! M. Gatt

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Annie H
Reviews.Content: We arrived a day late due to a hoax bomb scare at our transit airport but the 2 rooms we booked were kept for us. The receptionist was matter of fact and our only help to our rooms was to be shown the lift and which floor to get off. The hotel has definitely seen better days but I understand this is fairly standard for Venetian hotels. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were a decent size. We asked for a kettle and this duly arrived with tea and coffee and there was a fridge stocked with drinks and water. The noise from outside finally died down after midnight but we accepted this as it was Carnavale. Breakfast could be classed somewhere between disaster and horrendous. The food was as expected for a continental breakfast but was of poor quality. We had to wait for a table to be cleared..there was a mess of crockery and cutlery on every table. There appeared to be only 2 staff in the dining room and they were clearly struggling..none of the 5 staff at the reception desk appeared to be in any hurry to help. Despite arriving for breakfast reasonably early, there wasn't any hot water or coffee, no hot food at all and we had to ask 3 times before we got any service at all. The girl who attended us was actually a housemaid and should have been making up the rooms. She had no kitchen experience at all. The only good thing I can say about this hotel is that it's location is excellent, being literally 20 yards from St Marks Square. Clearly my friends and I will not be booking this hotel again. Despite this we have enjoyed our brief stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointing intro to Venice”
Reviews.Author: judy k
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice a day early for our cruise, and spent one night here in Sept/11. We had some difficulty negotiating the cobblestones in San Marco, and the steps up and down the bridge connecting to the hotel due to extra luggage for the cruise. Upon arrival we were checked in and directed to our room - no help from any staff- it took us several trips in a tiny elevator, and negotiating hallways and stairs to reach our small room. For over 340 Euro we were truly disappointed. The front desk staff were surly at times and at all times had an aloofness that does not make a traveller comfortable. The bathroom was appalling - desperately in need of a update - shabby decor, uncomfortable fixtures. The bedding was also in need of replacement. All in all a dreadful start to our tour and an unfortunate introduction to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful location. My second stay at this hotel in two years.”
Reviews.Author: Frenchgirl60
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from my fourth stay in Venice in a few years. It was my second stay at Albergo San Marco. The previous was in November 2009 for 4 nights with two friends ( rooms 208 and 406). This time I was with my daughter and we stayed for 3 nights in a superior room (114) on the first floor, overlooking the canal. I am always surprised when I read bad reviews of places I have enjoyed, and this hotel seems to have a few of those. However my experience is not at all negative. The personnel of the hotel were always very courteous. They speak different foreign languages quite fluently, but enjoy your trying to greet them at least in Italian, which I always do. I was able to print my travel documents ( free of charge ) on the printer attached to the computer in the lobby, and the receptionist helped me when one sheet of paper stuck in the printer at one point. Breakfast is good, plenty of choice: hot croissants, eggs, ham and cheese, different sorts of bread, cereals...etc....I have never been to Venice in the high season so I cannot say what it would be like then, in the frenzy of summertime; best avoided, probably. The room was large, very clean, furnished with period furniture, a good bed, and good heating. The bathroom was well equipped and spotless. Impeccable linen changed daily. I can imagine that it could be noisy. Despite our double glazing windows, we heard the workers in the street one morning. But when in Venice one wants to be up and about, visiting, not staying in bed all morning, so it did not disturb us. In conclusion, this second stay has convinced me that this hotel is a good choice; its location is superb, next to San Marco square, it has reasonable prices for Venice, and I would definitely stay there again on my next visit. I have stayed at two other hotels in Venice -Marconi on the Rialto - and Al Sole in San Polo- both were ok, but this one is equally good, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good hotel just in the Heart of San Marco”
Reviews.Author: mehilba
Reviews.Content: Overall a very good hotel , nice service , good breakfast. The rooms are Ok in size , nice , Free Internet connection. The hotel is old fashion but well maintained .

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Preeti55
Reviews.Content: The Location was very good and convenient to reach. It's right on San Marco square. We were there for 3 nights. We had a triple room which had a double bed in one room and a single bed in one and was quite good in size. I only wish that the bathroom was well planned .The size was fine but it really needed a shower cubicle. The shower had a curtain and the water would all flow out if you were not very very careful while having a shower. The rest of our stay was really good. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Bad the rest”
Reviews.Author: HTPWT24
Reviews.Content: This hotel has seen better times. It is independently owned and operated. It needs major renovations. Is a small hotel, but that has nothing to do with clean and good appereance. The best parts are the location (just a few yards from Pza. San Marco) and the Wi-Fi (which only is for 20 hours). The desk PC in the lobby is not so easy to use with a different keyboard. Reception staff are not friendly nor helpful. A Continental breakfast is included. It is more than coffee/tea, juice and toasts. There is yogurt, scrambled eggs, fruits, cold cuts, cheeses and dry cereal. But quality of food is mediocre. The dining room is understaffed. There is small fridge stocked with water and sodas in the room. Upon request you can get an electric kettle with instant coffee and tea, plus the staples that go with these. But we only got it once and after requesting it twice we gave up. The chamber maid was the only friendly and cooperative person in the hotel. She looked Asian to us. We had a two bedrooms room. We have the luggage in the next door room, since the room with king size bed is not that roomy. The other room seems like it had a double bed, but now there is a twin bed in there. There are no double pane windows so we could hear all the street noise. Early check out was not an option, even though we are leaving the hotel at 4:30AM. The old grouchy man told us it will only take a minute to do the check out. He was not the one there in the morning. It was actually a young Jesus Christ looking fellow, wearing no uniform and not very friendly either. Not even â€œhave a nice tripâ€�. We were not very impressed with them, hotel or the service. Itâ€™s listed as a 3 star hotel. I wonder how much you need to pay for decent service in this town? Maybe we got this lousy deal becasue we requested an AARP discount. They gave us the worst of their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!”
Reviews.Author: psun21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights before heading on a cruise. We loved the location, considering it was across from the bus and within walking distance to the cruise terminals. This was an added bonus, despite the noise and traffic of the area. We selected the canal view room on the 4th floor, which mostly gave us a view of the busy bus area. I didnâ€™t like the idea of the noise, so we asked if there was an alternative. The service was very accommodating, considering they let us view the garden room on the lower-level. Between the two rooms, we went with the â€˜canal viewâ€™ (using this term loosely). We liked how they let us choose and was patience with me. I found out that the room was virtually sound proof, so you didnâ€™t hear the noise anyway. The room was spacious and well decorated. Like I said, the service in the hotel was excellent. The front desks spoke perfect English, as well as being pleasant and helpful. The breakfast buffet was moderate; comparing that we wouldâ€™ve paid major USD for the same breakfast outside. After our first half-day of the walking around in Veniceâ€™s 97 degree heat/humidity; we were relieved to have a hotel that was so close to restaurants, bars, and the bus terminalâ€¦oh and more importantly gelato stands. Since the location was accessible, this saved us from having to pay for the expensive and crowded Vaporetto or bus taxi OR worst having to carry our luggage over all those steps and bridges. Another reason why we thought the location was so perfect - no matter how disoriented and lost youâ€™ll get; the hotel is in front of easy to find landmarks and bridges. Overall we LOVE Venice and canâ€™t wait to spend more time here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location very average breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Desiree001
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect, straight behind San Marco Piazza!! The staff were helpful which was appreciated. The room was great. When we originally booked we requested a room with canal view which was given! The room was clean and a reasonable size for Venice. The only part that pulled the hotels rating down for us was the breakfast. The breakfast staff seemed to be cranky the whole time, unhappy to assist any requests. I witnessed the staff being quite rude to guests from another hotel in saying they were to pay 30 Euros for breakfast. I was astounded as there was no way the breakfast was worth this amount. The food was very disappointing and we felt reluctant on asking for restocking. It was very disappointing. Otherwise we were very happy and would come to stay again but have breakfast elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room”
Reviews.Author: DavidH642
Reviews.Content: Best Western Albergo San Marco is located 30 yards off San Marco square, and about 200 yards from the water taxi drop-off. Still not easy to find unless you have been before. You pay for the location but San Marco square is so busy we typically did not spend much time there during the day. Did dance on the square in the evening to a live band...very nice. If you like big crowds this hotel is the place. The rooms were spacious and clean. The front desk help were polite but not really complete in their advice. They arranged for a water taxi to take us to Murano Island but neglected to tell us that the the taxi was in fact sponsored by one factory....we were taken to this factory through the back door met by a very slick young man, toured through the factory spent a fair amount of money (was told this was the only factory on the island) hustled back onto the taxi and back to San Marco. Our front desk clerk new all this but did not volunteer any information. They also told us that a water taxi would cost 140 Euro to the marco Polo airport. We found one at the dock for 100 euro, and found out that a public water taxi cost only 15 euro each. The front desk tells you only so much....I suspect they get a commission for the more costly services. We would probably select another hotel as the location was not all that important and we preferred the quieter parts of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Location is ideal”
Reviews.Author: nuoverose
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop on our 2 week tour of Italy. It is exceedingly convenient to St. Mark's Square and close to the Rialto as well. We were there during the film festival and also a regatta was going on when we arrived, so the streets were even more crowded than usual, making it difficult to make our way with lots of luggage up and down the stairs in front of the hotel. When we arrived the room wasn't ready yet, so we were told to leave our luggage on the first floor landing, which gave us pause because it was unattended. We found the staff were professional but not really friendly. The breakfast was OK but they were slow to replenish food and utensils that were running low. The free WiFi was a nice perk and the AC worked well. We had plenty of space in the room and it was clean enough but the bed not the most comfortable. The bathroom had mold and a very awkward shower door. Voices and construction noise from outside were disruptive at times. Overall we were satisfied on the strength of the location. Local city tax was $3/person per night.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Albergo San Marco Venice”
Reviews.Author: Dask444
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and ideally located for San Marco Square and Rialto Bridge. The room (411) was a good size and found clean and tidy. Two single beds put together with venician furniture/decor. Bedding and towels changed daily. We mainly spent our time out and about exploring Venice and returned for a well earned rest and a quite drink late in the evening. Breakfast was a continental breakfast but sufficient choice. Would definitely recommend and use again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Attitude!”
Reviews.Author: QueenBozaki
Reviews.Content: Just to give you an idea of how unfriendly the staff is, when my friend and I checked in, the man at the front desk said, "And, you don't get the free breakfast! You Expedia people always think you get the breakfast for free!" What a way to start the stay. We didn't even book on Expedia. Things got even worse from there. We had huge chunks of mold in our room and when we asked to be moved to a different room, we were told that since we booked the "Economy" room, that's what we should expect and that's the room we got. Couple that with the fact that we didn't have hot water for two and a half days and we were not happy campers. Apparently, Italian maintenance workers don't work on Sundays and when we didn't have hot water again on Monday, we insisted that they move us around the corner to the Best Western Cavalletto, which was about a 1000% improvement. Their overall attitude was terrible, and we paid a premium for the room. All the front desk would do was yell at us every time we called to ask when the hot water would be fixed! Do not stay in this horrible establishment. For a hotel that carries the Best Western name, it was a disgrace.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with exÑ�ellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Sergel_11
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was very beautiful and very much in the Venetian style. Internet is free in the rooms. We enjoyed our stay here. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Scalarnet
Reviews.Content: For a clean, affordable hotel located near everything the BW Albergo is a great find. Central to San Marco, Rialto Bridge, and Accademia. Free wireless and an acceptable breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A decent place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: InessaZ
Reviews.Content: If you decide to go to Venice I highly recommend staying near San MArco Square. This square lights up a night and everyone stays up late and enjoys life. We had a room on the top floor with our very own patio which made for some nice evenings and lunch breaks. The only down side is being next to the clock tower that start to ring a little before 6:30am. But then again there are clock towers and bell towers from all the Cathedrals all over Italy so it is something to get used. It was fairly easy to get to our hotel from the water taxi, just make sure you pack light because dragging your suitcase up and down the stairs is not fun.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well located and great air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: NMBNovaScotia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel and found it reasonably priced, minutes away from San Marco Square, very clean with great a/c. The front desk staff were friendly and it was the perfect spot for our stay. Definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Good Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: lissethg103
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel in the middle of all the shops in Venice very close to St Marks Square. We booked a family room had 2 separate bedrooms 1 bathroom it had everything we needed lots of closet space. Nice decor beds were comfortable. The breakfast was very good delicious pastries. We only stayed 1 night here. We tried to book another night but it was too pricey found another hotel around the block for half the price. I think the rate was a bit high for this hotel, but we did enjoy our stay.

Reviews.Title: “If this place isnt good enough, I dont know what is!”
Reviews.Author: bennybex
Reviews.Content: This review is written on the understanding that a hotel to us, is just a base. We dont use consierge/room service, reception, facilities etc.We have a guide book and just wander off and explose, happening upon places, or not as the case maybe. This hotel is quite literally off St Marks Square. We have stayed at others that promise the same, but really are not. Turn right off the square and it is just there in front of you. We arrived late from Treviso airport, catching the water bus up the grand canal to St Marks Sq. Reception were expecting us, and as we were a group opf 5, we were allocated an apartment in a building around the corner. The place was awsome. It was huge, with 3 bedrooms, all imaculate and a bathroom that was recently refurbed. The place was spotless, comfortable beds, thick towels, and sheets/towels changed daily. (We stayed 5 days). Right by the apt was a bar which we ate at as it was so late arriving, but it was horrendously expensive. Most of the places we fond were fairly dear, though there was a place near to the rialto bridge where you could get dinner and wine for about 7euro. On our last day the flooding was so high it was up to our knees, all over the city. The hotel staff came to the apt with wellies, allowed us the use of the apt till we left in the afternoon, and staff could not have been more helpful. Breckfast was included in the price Â£135 per night, and was great. Fruit/yougur/toast, cheese/ham/omlet. Tea, coffee, ask for hot chocolate if you want it. I really cant think of one reason why anyone could complain. St Marks square and Rialto are signposted wherever you go, so I would suggest either of these areas to stay in as no matter what time you came home, its possible to find your way back. We had bilinis at harrys bar as it was my birthday. 70euro for 5 drinks, 2 of which were non alcoholic versions for the kids. Delicious drink, but barely worth it other than to say youve been there. The bottled version is nothing campared to the original though I have to say, much as it agrieves me! This hotel was perfect, but we did have an apt and were not in the main building. Id most definately recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for Money!”
Reviews.Author: Jafars
Reviews.Content: Was on honeymoon with my wife during the winter season in Venice at the San Marco Best Western Inn. On the up side: Excellent value for money, right in the heart of the San Marco shopping district, excellent staff services, very good rooms with a Venecian theme to it. Windows in the rooms overlook the streets of San Marco. Overall, an excellent and most romantic experience, I would highly recommend the Best Western Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant Staff Belligerent”
Reviews.Author: vcartujano
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had lunch at the hotel restaurant. When we wanted to pay with two credit cards, we were told that it cannot be done. When we insisted, the waiter/cashier got angry and told us to just pay and just keep quiet as we are in his place. It is his place and it is his rules. My friend got indigestion from the food she ate. Terrible and frightening place to be in. Avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and unhelpful staff, really noisy - avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: kellie_a_m
Reviews.Content: I was originally booked at the Ambassador Tre Rose Hotel but on arrival was told I'd been moved to the Best Western. The staff were so unfriendly and unhelpful - one guy seemed most put out that I didn't speak Italian - and everything seemed to be too much trouble. Being November, the area was flooded on one of the days I was there and I was told I wasn't allowed to leave the hotel and they refused to move a flood barrier that was at the front door so I could get out, even though there was no water within meters of the hotel entrance (I climbed over it and left - in my wellies!) Very noisy at night time, but probably the norm for anywhere so close to St Mark's square. The room was clean and comfortable enough, and even though the bathroom was tiny, it was well-kept. Do yourself a favour - skip this one.

Reviews.Title: “Good value basic tourist hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: WardenRon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very much better than some of the negative Trip Advisor reviews would have you believe. We actually booked it by mistake, thinking it was another Best Western very close by. It was only after we realised our error that we looked at the earlier reviews and feared that we had made a terrible mistake. But in fact the hotel was fine as a base for tourism. The building is characterful and tastefully furnished. The location is great - just a few yards from St. Mark's Square; the beds were large and very comfortable; and our room was clean and of a good size, although the bathroom was very small - and might get smelly in hot weather if you didn't run the extractor fan for a good length of time. Breakfast was very good value at 6 euros. This probably explains why non-residents eat there, which does mean that it got crowded and chaotic at the peak hour of about 9 a.m. At 8.15 it was fine. Yes, there were a few mosquitoes (bugs in American) - but so there are in any hotel in marshy Venice that is not hermetically sealed; and one of those plug-in repellent devices that you can buy at any airport kept them at bay. Staff were not great, but friendly enough if you at least said buona sera and gave your room number in Italian. They had clearly had enough of dumb questions from tourists - but we thought the reply "Madam, this is Venice" was a perfectly apt response to "How do I get my bags to the vaparetto without going over any of those damned bridges?" Finally the price - on a non-refundable book-ahead deal - was very reasonable for the location and standard of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast shambolic”
Reviews.Author: alid230135
Reviews.Content: Nice central hotel just off St Mark's Square. Rooms on the canal tend to be noisy as it is on one of the main passageways off of the square. Rooms comfortable but the arrangements for breakfast are chaotic. There were insufficient tables and staff for the number of guests and people appear to come into breakfast from an adjacent hotel. Very often it was a case of waiting for tables to be cleared and set up and asking for food to be replenished.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel, unfriendly snide & rude staff who made us feel unwelcome”
Reviews.Author: SuperRach101
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband and daughter for 3 nights and we all felt very unwelcome as the staff were snide and rude, even to my young daughter. The "Free" internet does not exist which was a massive worry for me as we needed boarding passes printed for our return online check-in only flights. After the 5th time trying to get the staff to help we were told we could pay 25 euro to print them (!!!) or go to an internet cafe instead - so we spent 4 hours trying to find a cafe with a printer we could use, which ruined our last day as we were totally NOT going to pay 25 euro to the really horrible receptionist for internet access which was supposed to be FREE.... The double bed was 2 singles pushed together & really uncomfortable and i got bitten by fleas during our stay and my arms came out in big itchy spots! If this is a typical "BestWestern hotel" then Bestwestern will never get my business again! This is at best a 2 star hotel made ten times worse by horrible rude and unhelpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: tokyo2van
Reviews.Content: We booked our vacation online and chose this hotel due to the good price and location. The hotel is right next to St. Mark's Square and our window overlooked the canal with gondoliers. Very Venetian! The double bed was actually two singles pushed together and there was a strong perfume smell in the room. Perhaps it is to mask the canal water smells? (The canals did not smell when we were there but I've heard they can.) The bathroom was just a shower, no bathtub. The Continental breakfast was pleasant and filling. We had a great sleep as it was so quiet at night. All in all, we had a good stay - the service was good and through our package, this hotel was a good bargain.

Reviews.Title: “I cannot recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: chatnoire1967
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the recent reviews of this hotel. Although the location next to St. Mark's Square is good, the room was definitely dirty, as was the bathroom (opened packages of shampoo were left from previous guests). Room was not well-laid out- You could barely get by the bed to the door and the door itself was hard to keep closed. There are definitely bugs or mosquitoes of some sort as I woke the next day covered in welts on my arms and face which are still quite itchy 3 days later. The front desk staff was not overly friendly and bordered on rude actually. The hotel just does not have a friendly vibe and it's cleanliness is suspect. I hate to write a negative review but I feel like people should know there might be a problem with bugs.

Reviews.Title: “IT IS A HORRIBLE HOTEL FOR SOMEONE WHO HAS GREAT AMBITIONS TO SEE AND RELAX IN VENICE.”
Reviews.Author: objective_10
Reviews.Content: much to our surprise and ambitions ( best western ) it turned out to be ( worst western) chain,arriving at the hotel after dragging our luggage and climbing the "bridges" in venice, we arrived at the door of the hotel,we were surprised that we had to hold the main door through which only one person can pass,forcing the luggage through this door through a very narrow path to the reception where the receptionist told us that this is not the hotel in which we were staying,we went out to another san marco hotel,and the receptionist there was a bit more clever to check the list of all names and told us again that we should go to the first hotel as our reservation is there.the lady in the first hotel did not bother to look into her list the first time,when i told her and insisted that the receptionist of the other hotel confirmed our hotel ,then she said yes without any appology or courtesy.lucky enough there was a so called "porter" who brought our luggage to our room. the next day our room was no done till (at 14.00 hrs),they said there are alot of rooms to be cleaned.the bathroom was old,old bathtub,dirty water getting out from the ground of the bathroom whenever we washed in the sink or used the bathtub!!! no fan in the bathroom,instead an open window through which swarms of mosquitos were welcomed through to attack and infect our skin at night.the laundry bags (dirty laundry) and the vaccum machine were most of the time at the door of our room and in the coridor leading to our room.the t.v. was flat screen,but nothing to watch no interesting channels for children or worlwide like any respectful hotels.the breakfast was barely close to average most of the time depleted by 8.00 a.m., not enough plates were put at the table to put food in,we had to refill our plates again (this is an excellent way to cut down on people's eating...as if one can eat more than he can. support at the front reception desk was poor,we were afraid talking to the receptionist (as if he is einstein and does not want anybody to interrupt his pearls of wisdom).many decisions were taken on our own without any professional support from the receptionits.at night we could not get a good night sleep as the door of the room could easily pass light and noise underneath it,and from the outside noises of the drunk people on the back side of the hotel irrespective of the fact that the bathroom "window" was closed. it is a real pitty that someone is humilated in staying in such a "best western" hotel it should be called "worst western" because after saving money a whole year long to enjoy a good vacation in the romantic city of venice,you feel cheated deep in your heart that you did not get 15-20% of the money value of what you paid,you get out from the city of love depressed.we would never reccommend this hotel or any of "worst wester" hotels to any of our friends not even to our enemies!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Smelled Terrible.”
Reviews.Author: RoanokeVa
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it had a high rating, a good location, and really good rates. I thought it was too good to be true and it was. Our hotel room smelled terrible. We first noticed it when we came in, but thought it was just from being closed up. However, by the second night it was so bad it woke my mom up in the night. We left the next day as planned. The room was small, and the shower didn't drain properly and poured onto our carpet. I would not stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & service.”
Reviews.Author: PSUgirl98
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The location is fantastic, steps away from St. Mark's Square. The room & bathroom was comfortable & clean, the breakfast was very good and the staff were very kind.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: roblesv
Reviews.Content: Hotel service was terrible. First of all the towels and bedsheets reek. I got interrupted in my room TWICE. One time they knocked and wanted to see if there was anyone in the room, the other time they just opened the door! extremely rude. I had to switch rooms and was told that my luggage was going to be transferred to the other room only to find that the "porter" didn't start work until 11am so they couldn't move my luggage. I had to do it myself, I was not going to wait all day for the "porter" to move my stuff - i had already planned my day. Overall, this hotel doesn't really care for the clients just the euros. Would not recommend to anyone. Also, forget about using the internet while because their other hotel "partner" charges you a ridiculous amount per minute.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: Matt082
Reviews.Content: Unfriendly service upon check-in, slamming down key on counter, and barking orders where our room was. When asked why the hostile behavior just met with shrug. Baby cot was extra $40 per night and not told in advance. Later asked for pizzeria near St. MarksSq, and given a restaurant far away (must have some sort of shady connection).The hotel is centrally located and the rooms are reasonable for the $100 we spent, but the scowls each morning did not make our trip. Not surprisingly, Best Western did not respond to our request for explanation of rude service. Bottom line, if you want to come to Venice for a special trip - do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Albergo San Marco - Just as you dreamt Venice to be...”
Reviews.Author: JabberwockyIndia
Reviews.Content: Hotel Albergo San Marco Excellent location - just 2 mins walk from Piazza San Marco. Rooms are well furnished, some overlook a narrow canal (not much used, but fits perfectly into what a tourist looks for), some overlook the street below. The breakfast is the usual Venetian sparse affair. But ok to fill the stomach. At 90 euros in off season (Winter) it is still worth it for the location. Incidentally, location is not so important in Venice - it is a small town, you are always about 15 mins walk from a water bus stop. A canal and bridge is always 3 minutes walk and most hotels have a view of one. Yes - the shuttle bus does takes time - about 30 mins from Piazza de San Marco to the rlwy stn. But if the cost savings are high, stay afar - you won't miss much. And you could then afford the only remaining 100 euro ticket at the grand opera house! Btw a visit to this place is a must - located 5 mins behind San Marks square. Tours all thru the day. Buy a ticket in advance (they start at 15 euro) Tip : Winter is a good time to visit Venice - it is not at all crowded, hotels are emptier and cheaper, you don't have to line up much, places are not noisy. Unfortunately it can get real cold... You would most of the time be wearing 3 layers of clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Valentine's Day and Carnival 2010”
Reviews.Author: PSGCities
Reviews.Content: Good service, very good location. Nice breakfast for walking around in Venice all day.. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great location - thats about it”
Reviews.Author: Ipoxy
Reviews.Content: The location to this hotel is impeccable, just seconds away from piazza San Marco. This was our first visit to Venice and I would recommend everyone to stay a bit further away from piazza San Marco than this. The distance in Venice is small no matter where you stay, but the price is much higher the closer to the square you get. The room was ok in size, but could need some improvements and seemed a bit worn. The staff seemed a bit glazed to us, seemed like they diddent care how our stay was. It was a bit hard to get hold of the waiter in the restaurant, and the food was very late. We felt a bit like the hotel was very populare and that the staff diddent care if we came back or not, because they still would have a full hotel no matter what. If I go back to Venice I will stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant chill winter in Venice”
Reviews.Author: RuiS
Reviews.Content: Hello, I stayed 2 nights in this hotel, the room is not very big but all very clean (original bathroom!) and has a comfortable bed... The location is excellent (30 mts of the Square of S.Marcos!) and we know how much that it is expensive in Venice or in any other siege with this type of spotlight. The breakfast is just for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: drewantha
Reviews.Content: Just steps from San Marco Plaza. A bit of a schlep from the water bus but worth it. Rooms clean and medium sized. Quiet. Breakfast sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: oreo_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in October. We booked through their prepay site, so the price was a good value for Venice. The location is it's best point. Our rooms were good, bathrooms nice. The breakfast and the staff, not so good. I agree with a previous review that the woman at the front desk was not helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Venetian experience”
Reviews.Author: DebbieDee1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Best Western Albergi-San Marco. Location and price were very good. It was close to St. Mark's Square and easy to find after getting off the water taxi from airport. Also, it had air-conditioning which was a priority for us in August. The room was very small but clean. Staff was accomodating and breakfast was good.. Elsewhere food was not so good. Frozen pizza we had at home was better than the 2 times we had in restaurants there. However, I did enjoy cuttlefish spaghetti. Photo ops and scenery were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Venise Hotel / just Nice, pricey but so romantic and in middle of the most beautiful city of the world”
Reviews.Author: Greggill
Reviews.Content: Good on every point, get the breakfast in bed it s awesome. fresh ait and nice view, right next to San marco plaza, confortable and the price is still ok for Venise. Loved the city and was not disappointed by the hotel. Good value fr Venise (don t forget it s one of the most expensive place in the world...)

Reviews.Title: “Ok - but not excellent...”
Reviews.Author: MadsCopenhagenDK
Reviews.Content: We stayed only 1 night - and our first impression of the reception area was not all too good - it had a funky smell (from pibe tobacco...). I think it was the clerk (as the smell was gone next day when he wasn't there...). It's quite outdated - but location is fabulous!! No more than 50m from San Marco Square - hard to get any closer! Our room was surprisingly nice (compared with the standard of the public areas). The bath room was brand new - and the room itself was quite romantic - with windows facing one of the canals. There was also a flat screen (of good size) with sat tv (incl. CNN and BBC World - so we at least could find two channels where they spoke a language we could understand). The aircondition in our room was working perfectly. The breakfast not recommendable - the bread was definitely not fresh and the juice was watered down etc. A disappointment... All in all we were very happy with our stay - but mainly because the room was in very good condition - very romantic and cosy. But the rest of the hotel is not really worth the money...

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: loch24
Reviews.Content: This hotel smells dank and musty and needs whole overhaul in terms of decor. The bathroom of our room had obviously just been redone so that was very nice but the room itself was not very nice at all, stuffy, hot and dark. Breakfast was poor with not much choice, staff weren't all that friendly - I wouldn't stay in this hotel again. We only stayed here because we couldn't get twin rooms in other hotels at the last minute, but if I'd known what this hotel was going to be like, I'd have shared a double bed! It does, however, have a fantastic location near the square and there are lots of restaurants, cafes, shops, etc. within very easy walking distance. If you're not planning to spend any time in the hotel apart from sleeping, this might be OK for you, but otherwise I'd avoid it until they've redone the entire hotel.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE and NOT WORTH THE COST!”
Reviews.Author: bonnacher
Reviews.Content: The Best Western name seems to have very little to do with this below standard hotel The location was perfect but the hotel is poorly run, the female desk clerks are rude and know absolutely nothing about making guests feel comfortable. Claim it is air conditioned..NOT! This was not to say there were no airconditioners, they just do not work well or not at all. (Certainly rather unbearable during the heat wave there when it was 38 degrees C. Went to 3 rooms before one was at least big enough for 2 people. The female desk cleark was 'put ot' clearly by our requests for better rooms, saying.. "The room is very nice!)Musty odours, stale air. Limited breakfast. Shabby. Would definitely not recommend this, especially for nearly $300 per night Canadian.

Reviews.Title: “No value”
Reviews.Author: boca76
Reviews.Content: The only good things about this hotel is it's location and the friendly staff. The rooms are poor and full of cockroaches. The breakfast was terrible. And all that for 300 Euros. My advise is don't go there.

Reviews.Title: “great location good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nzaar
Reviews.Content: The location was BRILLIANT. A 30 sec walk from San Marco, which is the main happening square at Venice. Staff was very friendly & smiling and helpful. No bellboys or beck and call service, but I guess that's fair at this price in Europe. The room size was decent while the bathroom was tiny, but spotlessly clean and everything was in perfect working order. The AC didn't work the first day, when I complained I was told that the weather is ok and they will work on the AC, and if it's intolerable they'll change my room. The AC was fixed the next morning. For wifi I had to come into the lobby didn't work in my room. The breakfast was nice as well - I loved the omlette! But like I said before, in venice since transportation is restrictive the location is key and this hotel is probably the best located one in all of venice! But obviously you'll have to pay for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position”
Reviews.Author: scanm
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Position just near the square. Easy walk to most attractions. Take the so called 'Tour' to Murano. It is a rouse just to get you over there and try and sell you something, and you may need to catch the ferry back, but it a beatiful area to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hhugs4you
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to Italy, One of the hotels we stayed in was the Best Western Albrego San Marco Venice, Italy. To say it was in the perfect location is an understatement. It was right next to Piazza San Marco, only being seperated by a small canal.. The staff was friendly and helpful, the room was beautifully appointed, and the breakfast was great. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone going to venice.

Reviews.Title: “fab trip in venice”
Reviews.Author: JPDLEIGH
Reviews.Content: just returned from 4 great days in venice, hotel great value for money, changed rooms on 1st day as too small, but no problem for the staff, very helpful. next room was very good. asked for tea/coffee making facilities which was no problem. able to replenish milk etc from the bar with no difficulty. breakfast more than adequate. great value for money & excellent location. venice very expensive, tea in san marco min 8.50euro. hence the kettle came in useful mid afternoon!. eating out very expensive & often poor quality, aim purly for tourists. STAY AWAY FROM RESTAURANT NEOMI, in alley-way near hotel, food disgusting & very expensive. tiny bottle wine 12euro & small bottle beer 6 euro, added service charge on drinks bill, even though it was stated no service charge. never used vaperetto, water bus, as again expensive but walked everywhere which is the best way to see what venice has to offer. did go down grand canal to get to the hotel, which is a must, even just the once, 6.50euro for an hour. No where to sit in piazza squares as this seems to be discouraged & to have a coffee sitting down is expensive so found small non tourist places to rest & chill. saying all this venice is stunning, full of culture & beauty. a must for city lovers.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location except ...”
Reviews.Author: Zabren
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Venice where we stayed in this hotel. It's perfectly located, just a few steps from San Marco, the Vaporettos and the Vaporetto from the aiport - See below for some hints on some things - We got a good deal with Expedia, for 3 nights we got a room at 211euros, non refundable. A few days later the best price was something like 386euros for the same dates. Room (212) was a good sized room for European Standards, bathroom good sized also, an old fashioned hanging closet with normal hangers (not the wire kind !) with a valuable digit coded vault in it (this is good to have for your passport and things you don't want to carry around) plus a view on a small street. Breakfast is included, with croissant, pain au chocolat (chocolat like croissants), wrapped cakes (good to have for the munchie hour while visiting !), juices, cheese and cold cuts, bread, jams, butter, nutella (yum), etc. No eggs (darn). The bad part was that the windows were thin (pigeon flying would make it shake - am serious ). You could hear people talk (Italians can be loud), pigeons crooning, the bar downstairs, if you are a light sleeper (my husband heard nothing-lucky him-). But that's the only withdraw that I can think of. Personnel not very smiley, and say only what they have to say, not one word more ! If you want internet access, it'll cost you 10 euros for 1 hour- if you only need it for 15minutes, well, that's tought noogies on you ! OK things that are good to know while you are in Venice : From the airport, you can take the Vaporetto. There is a stand that sells them when you exit the customs area on the left. However they don't take Credit cards, only cash. For two people, two round trips cost 50 euros. BUT there is another ticket stand right by the Vaporetto and they take credit cards - had we known...The people that sell them aren't very happy-goers nor know how to smile. It's like they won't make an effort to help you, they are probably tired of all these tourist sand havent yet realized that it's a part of life....A taxi wil cost you an arm and a leg. You can alos take a bus, I think around 1 or 2 euros (had we knwon...) that take you to a Central station where you then take the Vaporetto to bring you closer to where you want to go...The Vaporetto is like their subway/bus system...When you are "set-in" you can walk to everything, takes time as you sometimes keep walking around in circles, easy to get lost. We bought a 12hour Vaporetto ticket in order to visit the islands: Murano, Burano (loved it the best) Lido (beach there)...wanted to do more but didn't have the time and the weather was wet and cold. Go tto Florian for coffee, capucino or hot chocolat and pastries...it's been there since the earth was created. Restaurants are to avoid : tourist traps. A must are Trattorias and Osterias - there are so many. Avoid, however, the ones where the waiters are waiting for you outside. On the bill you'll see that the bread is charged - can't avoid that unless you refuse the bread basket when they put it out it on the table. No tip necessary- already included - unless your waiter was really exceptionnal. You can go listen to Classic concerts, sometimes they sell ticket outside of churches, or around schools, or main areas such as San Marco place. You buy a ticket earlier that day or right before that night show (if space still available, that is). A good Venice cocktail (to my taste) is the SPRITZ has a little of sparkling wine, mixed with sparkling water, Campari and a zest of lemon or orange. Delicious Gelati - all over - 2 big scoops cost 2euros. For lunch, you might want to grab a sandwich "Venitian style" and eat while walking around (not on San Marco place: eating, loitering not allowed ) alot of Venitians do that for lunch - lots of varieties, and also pizzas (if you want it hot, you can ask) cost is around 3euros50 a sandwich, and the prices are the same everywhere, whether you're at San Marco ro lost in the middle of nowhere. A good place to munch in is in a Wine Bar - they have varieties of food (a bit like Spanish Tappas) and you can nibble on everything (you pay of course ! ) while having the choice of wine (sweet, strong, white, red, rose..). Don't buy mask or souvenirs with street sellers, you can find much better in the shops. There are good Murano glass items such as rings, pendants, glasses, vases, ashtrays - everywhere also ! Good visiting, eating, drinking, shopping. We'll go back when it's dry and warm !

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, great beds and BEST location ever”
Reviews.Author: Pereira01
Reviews.Content: Its really easy to get lost in Venice, and i can assure you maps are no big help in this unique city. Also as there's no such thing as a cab driver to say "please take me to this adress", its fundamental that you pick a hotel that is easy to find. This Best Western San Marco is nothing but a gem just a bridge away from San Marco's Basilica. Very, very easy to find, with a cosy atmosphere, good breakfast, charming rooms with great showers and bath. Its not one of the cheapest you may find, but its worth every cent mainly beacause of the location. My tip is that if you want to book it (and you should) go straight to the website www.sanmarcohotels.com, since the best western website is awfully designed and not clear at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RDHD
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fun! It's not the nicest that we stayed in on our trip but it was quaint, comfortable and relaxing. The room and the bathroom were both fairly large and the bathroom had a nice sized tub. The flooring in the bedroom was a little bit goofy and uneven in spots, but it's a pretty old building so it wasn't a surprise....Our room was on the first floor above the restaurant so sometimes during the day it would be a bit noisy, but Venice and the Piazza San Marco are very busy places so it was to be expected. I especially liked the glass fixtures in the room. Quirky and unique! The hotel service was pretty good overall, but not exceptional. One of the attendants in the breakfast area was a little snarky and intense about where people sat but somehow that just made her fun to watch. Breakfast was decent....

Reviews.Title: “Best Location - Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 123daytripper
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel twice over the years - our first was in 2001. Re-visiting Venice, we thought we'd stay at the Albergo San Marco again and see if it was as good as the first time. It was even better. This hotel is so close to everyrhing, good for people who can't or don't want to walk alot. Room service was good, especially as our room had its own terrace - we had breakfast on our terrace both mornings and it was wonderfull for sips of ameretto after dinner when the Bell tower was all lighted. One thing about this hotel; it is expensive. From reading the other reviews, I've come to realise that at this hotel, you MUST pay for the Superior room, or don't stay here at all.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: JettMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is fantastic in relation to Palazzo San Marco. Our room was small but overlooked the canals and the bathroom more than adequate in relation to most hotels in this area. Breakfast was a real dissapointment and we found that each day we left food as it was stale. This was the only fault we found with the hotel. Through the day we walked away from San Marco to avoid the crowds, but headed back in the evening to enjoy the brilliant ambience of the palazzo and music.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DonnyMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great loction only seconds from St Marks square, the room was OK small but comfortable Staff were fine Breakfast was average. We had a front room with a balcony that opened onto the street great during the day but a bit noisy at night

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: notUSSAULLYamoaner
Reviews.Content: you cannot sleep as it is too noisy, the room service is terrible ie. two paper cups and two tea bags,no hot water for washing or bathing,very small double room, breakfast ok but food for the rest of the day is terrible,we were served meat that was bad and unedible !! windows do not shut properly so not only can you not shut out the incredible noise but you cannot shut out the stench from the open drain they call a canal outside we stayed in December when it was cold and frosty it must be horrendous in the summer at this hotel ( and the air conditioning did not work) in all we recommend find another hotel this is an expensive rip off

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly good stay”
Reviews.Author: Katty76
Reviews.Content: I was concerned about staying at the Albergo San Marco after reading previous reviews but I have to say that we found it to be very comfortable, excellently located and relatively easy to find! Yes the rooms are small (and vary quite a lot throughout the hotel in size), but it is in the heart of Venice so what do you expect? They were clean with good views (we looked up at the Campanile and down to the canal) and contained everything that you need in a hotel room - although we did have to ask for the tea and coffee facilities to be brought to the rooms. The staff were excellent, very helpful and friendly. We had a small problem with the type of rooms allocated to our party when we arrived but they did their best to resolve this as quickly as possible. Although the hotel is not directly accessible by Vaporetto it is literally a 5 min walk from any of the San Marco stops. The bar is small and expensive but not that much different to other bars in the area. I wouldn't rely on the restaurant for lunch/evening meals though. The snack food is OK but you can get much better quality meals at the numerous restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel deserves a stay”
Reviews.Author: rioverde
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel even after reading so many negative reviews online. I must admit I was very pleasantly surprised with our accommodations. As Americans I think we come to expect too much when traveling abroad. Yes, the rooms were small but very charming. The buildings in Venice are old! The kingsize bed and linens were very comfortable and the bathroom, very clean. The air conditioning was terrific and a flat screen TV was a plus. Another review complained about the breakfast. I found it terrific with salamis, yogurt, croissants, cheeses, juices and strong coffee. And many available tables. It was a very European flavor. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and courteous. And the location is the best. It's right off the Square through the archway next to the green tabled cafe. But you do have to walk up a steep flight of stairs over the bridge down to the hotel. Beware if you're hauling heavy luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: WiggyPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 recently stayed at the Hotel. The rooms were clean and the staff was very helpful. Most rooms have some type of air conditioning but they will not keep the room very cold, if you want a cold room. You can't beat the location, as it is a very short walk from the Square. Prices were ok and the restaurant in the Hotel is good. Breakfast can be included with your stay but is limited in it's offering. It's not the best Hotel in Venice but for a large family it's a good, clean and safe place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Floating Dumpster”
Reviews.Author: traveltrotters
Reviews.Content: Hotel un accessable by boat so get ready to drag your bags from the dock all the way through san marco square and fifty million people. When you arrive to the uninviting staff prepare to wait for them to finish playing solitare on the computer before giving you a key. when you take your own bags to your room because they apparently dont offer bail service either. you will put your bags in the 2x2 elevator and run threeflights of stairs to catch the because there isent enough room for people and their bags in the lift. god forbid someone on another floor summons the elevator while your in route or it could be bye bye bags on day one. when you ask for the largest most luxurious room they have witch i believe is a triple. (two room suite) you will be greeted by two twin mattresses shoved together to immitate a queen that nearly lays on the floor. If you suffer from closterphobia prepare to suffer alot the triple is about half the size of a small motel 6 and smells like hotel #2. The resturaunt serves up cuisine that would make the poster child for save the children hesitate to order. other than that everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Hazelnutz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Best Western Albergo San Marco for one day March 12-13. What a surprise! I read the reviews and was a bit nervous. I took a chance. I actually liked the hotel. The location was great, and the size of the room was better than I expected as well as the bathroom. The room looked recently remodeled. The hotel room had a bit of an ordor (I used a lot of fabreezed). The front desk staff kept to them selves (I'm sure to some it may seem unfriendly) but I was in Venice. The downside is that there is one elevator and the maid and cleaning staff used it as well. It was consitantly in use.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: droogieuk
Reviews.Content: Just got back!!! Great location, just a few steps from St Mark's Square...a real bonus being so close to vaporati, particularly when travelling with luggage. Room (318) was a good size, with traditional furnishings but modern feel... has flat screen tv. Bed was Kingsize, very comfortable and linen changed daily. Large bathroom with shower over bath, toilet, bidet and twin sinks. Found front desk staff to be helpful and friendly, providing kettle etc when asked and allowing us to store luggage both on arrival day and all of departure day as we had late flight home. Breakfasts were more than adequate...cereal, yoghurt, fruits, pastries, breadrolls, meat, cheese, juice, coffee/tea. There is some noise from passing foot traffic which I doubt you could escape from in most hotels in Venice as sound carries due to narrow streets which were densley packed even at this time of year. Would recommend as a good value for money accommodation. Ideal for first time visitors to Venice who want a central, easy to find hotel right in the heart of the major sights. Was almost put off booking this hotel by reading the negative reviews posted but am glad that we decided to check it out for ourselves....though would agree that it would probably be baking hot in the summer. Enjoy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely small, dark and noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mike043
Reviews.Content: The rooms are extremely small (ours was 3,0 x 2,5 m / 10 x 8 ft). Without the bathroom. And yes, they sold it as a double room. The two windows were to an extremely narrow backyard corridor and practically dark. Still very noisy during the night. On the positive side: The rooms were clean, nicely furnished, TV and Shower were working properly and the bed was comfortable. The breakfast was unaccetable for our taste: Consisting almost exclusively of preserved food. Factory made croissants and rolls, which will not change taste or shape for a week, "juice" wich has never seen a fruit from inside, yoghurt made of pectine, gelatine, aspartame and so on. No fresh fruit, none of the delicious italian pastries, no eggs. We avoided it eventually and went into one of the absolutely delicous bakeries nearby. On the positive side: The staff is friendly and helpful, the hotel is conveniently located in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelissaAmy
Reviews.Content: While the hotel was in an amazing location (right by the square but not too loud), the hotel was just average. The lobby is worn and service was acceptable, but not great. The first room we were given was so small you had the enter the bed at the foot because there was no room on either side! We upgraded to a bigger room, but it had a very unpleasant odor. Since it was the only bigger room available, we took it. After asking again the next day, the front desk had a different room for us and allowed us to move (so I guess they get points for that). If you want to be close to the action, this is an acceptable hotel. If you are looking for an above average hotel with some ammenities, this place is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Albergo San Marco”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine. A little hard to find from the vaparetto and, as with any Venice hotel, be prepared to schlep your luggage up and down over the steps of multiple canals. It's easy to get lost, but you never get bored going the same way twice. The hotel was clean - not cheap, but it seems like all hotels in Venice are expensive in the summer. It was worth it to stay right in Venice as opposed to a nearby place like Mestre. It's nice to walk or boat around throughout the day and into the night. What I wanted to specifically point out was something that the hotel offered, more so than something about the hotel itself. When we checked in, the front desk staff asked what we wanted to see in Venice. When we told him that we planned to go to Murano to see the famous glass blowing and glass items, he said that the hotel offered a FREE tour that meets at 9am the next morning in the lobby (not sure if this is offered everyday, but it was on the Thursday we were there). So we went downstairs the next morning at 9am and we were the only ones there. The front desk guy assured us that the tour would go on with just us. A nicely-dressed guy from off the street walked into the lobby to pick us up and walk us to a private water taxi. He found the right guy in his water taxi, hastily dropped us off, and we never saw him again. We got into the water taxi and we had concerns, because we had been told how expensive water taxis were. However, our experience was perfectly fine, as he was able to cut through some narrow canals that the vaparetto can't fit through and we got to Murano island in less than 10 minutes. He didn't ask for any money - we gave him a few euros as a tip. As soon as we got to the glass blowing factory, a representative of the factory met us and whisked us into his factory - we never saw the water taxi guy again. After we watched a demonstration, we were toured us through a very fancy gallery with very expensive pieces. No pressure to buy, but if we did, you could be sure that the water taxi guy, the "walker", and even the hotel front desk guy would all get a kick-back. When we finished there, we walked around Murano and took the vaparetto back to San Marcos on our own. I'm sure if we made a big purchase, they would have gladly sent another private water taxi to bring us back near the hotel. While the hotel was fine, I thought that it was most important to comment about this Murano tour, since many people might be interested but might be concerned. In the end, it was all above-board, it was FREE, and we enjoyed it despite our concerns as we saw it all transpire. Other than saving a few euros for the vaparetto, it absolutely got us to Murano much faster than any other method of transportation. Go to Murano! It's beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: dvg1027
Reviews.Content: Was hesitant to stay here because was not looking for a chain hotel and on top of that the worst chain hotel we ever stayed in was at a Best Western. But due to last minute reservations we ended up here. Loved the hotel. Could not believe how large the room was. Had a pants press and dehumidifier in the room, (great for my husbands allergies). Bathroom was very large also. Mini bar had a good assortment. There were extra pillows and blankets in the room. And there was a informational booklet that offered other things that you may need like coffee/tea maker, ironing board, tooth paste, etc. As we never went to bed until at least 11 PM room noise was no problem. It was quiet by midnight. We actually enjoyed listing to the street sounds. Breakfast was good and you could sit right outside your hotel with your Bellini or Caffe. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Fouinard
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 2 days at this hotel in Venice. Location (30 seconds walking to Piazza St Marco) and cheap price for Venice are the main benefits of this hotel. Our triple rooom was comfortable and the bathroom recently renovated and spacious. Our room gave on the street which comes out from Piazza St-Marco. So it was noisy until 10:30 but after that it was quiet. Not sure if would stay there in the summer time when tourism is at its peak in Venice, although I'm sure it would be fine with an inside room (i.e. away from the street). Otherwise bring ear plugs as I did and you will sleep tight. Staff was very friendly and the included breakfast was varied, complete and plentifull. Adequate if you wanted to "load up" on food before going on your excursions of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night after a cruise and had been to Venice many times so location was of utmost importance. Hotel is located 1 short passageway off St. Marks. Staff was helpful when we asked for directions and the best way to get to the airport. Room had king bed, large bathroom and another smaller single bedded room for a triple. Street noise could be a problem in summer months but a/c would keep room quiet. We would stay again as rate was moderate and location, the best!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Value”
Reviews.Author: kristyann
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at this hotel for 5 days from 6th October, I was initally concerned because the other reviews were not so positive. However, I emailed the hotel directly explaining it was our 28th Wedding Anniversary and could we please have a "Room with a View". The hotel obliged, free of charge, and gave us a corner room which was absolutly delightful, with real Venitian furnishings and a real comfy Queen size bed,a small but adequate bathroom with a good shower, and best of all a delightful view over looking the canal with a Gondala berthed there, ever ready to take you straight from your doorstep on your trip (ADVICE -Don't bother queing at the "regular" berthing places if wishing to take a Gondala ride,there are plenty of single ones berthed at nearly every bridge and Canal, and very often these are the ones who you can "bartar" with about price. ALWAYS agree a price AND LENGHT OF JOURNEY before starting off. The hotel breakfast was great, hot croissants,brioch, and rolls, with jams, honey ,nutella,cheese plenty of cereals and yogurts to choose from and also wrapped cakes and pastries (which we took back to the room with us to take out ). The hotel staff were polite and courtious. If you should want a Tea/Coffee maker for your room, just ring down and ask reception, and they will bring up with plenty of choice of coffee and differant teas, milk etc, this service is also complimentory. The hotel is just 20 yards off San Marco's Palazzo, and only a few minutes walk from where the water bus drops you off at San Marco.You can also catch a water taxi direct to the hotel itself from the airport. We found the charm and convience of this hotel delightful and would definately stay here again, but would always email ahead for a larger ,or again, a corner room as some of the rooms can be rather small,as a lot are in Venice.On the whole I would thoughly recommend this hotel, if you want to be staying in the heart of Venice you could find no better location.
